channel.title: Prolog
channel.description:
Can anyone link me to some useful prolog tutorials and examples.
I'm learning AI and have to use prolog, I think its great but unfortunately my lecturer is only teaching the theory behind AI, which is fine, but doesn't help me on my quest for learning prolog.
I've got as far as arithmetic, recursion and using simple lists.
What I need to know is more, because it feels as if I should be able to use and know a lot more, and I have come to my assignment and have got stuck, I put it down to lack of knowledge in prolog as I have completed the task in objective c. (don't ask, I had xcode open)
[code]myLength([],0).
myLength([H|T],Length):- myLength(T,TailLength), Length is TailLength + 1.
myconcat(Tail,[A,B,C],[1,2,3,5,6]). myconcat(Tail,[A,B,C],[1,2,3,5,6,7,8,9]), myconcat([X,Y,Z],L2,Tail).
last(List,Last):- myconcat(Front,[Last],List).
last([X],X). last([H|T],X):- last(T,X).
evenlength([]). evenlength([A,B |T]):- evenlength(T).
oddlength([A]). oddlength([A,B |T]):- oddlength(T).
reverse([],[]). reverse([H|T],RevList):- reverse(T,List), myappend(H,List,RevList).
palindrome(List):- reverse(List,RevList), equalList(List,RevList).
equalList([],[]). equalList([H|Tail1],[H|Tail2]):- equalList(Tail1,Tail2).[/code]

item.title: Prolog
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I think this is the implementation we used:

http://www.swi-prolog.org/

So my code may need some tweaking to work in gprolog.

Read full topic

item.title: Prolog
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I’m using gprolog on Debian, I couldn’t find a good release for my mac (Tiger 10.7) so have to do all my work in the uni labs.

thanks for the download.

Read full topic

item.title: Prolog
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Ooh, I remember prolog, that stuff was fun, I wrote a bunch of little programs in it back in college. But which prolog are you using? I recall there being at least two popular implementations that weren’t compatible with each other (syntax differences and such).

Hehe, a quick search of my server reveals this old homework assignment:
www.moparisthebest.com/dl/prolog2.zip

Read full topic

item.title: Prolog
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Can anyone link me to some useful prolog tutorials and examples.

I’m learning AI and have to use prolog, I think its great but unfortunately my lecturer is only teaching the theory behind AI, which is fine, but doesn’t help me on my quest for learning prolog.

I’ve got as far as arithmetic, recursion and using simple lists.

What I need to know is more, because it feels as if I should be able to use and know a lot more, and I have come to my assignment and have got stuck, I put it down to lack of knowledge in prolog as I have completed the task in objective c. (don’t ask, I had xcode open)

[code]myLength([],0).

myLength([H|T],Length):-
myLength(T,TailLength),
Length is TailLength + 1.

myconcat(Tail,[A,B,C],[1,2,3,5,6]).
myconcat(Tail,[A,B,C],[1,2,3,5,6,7,8,9]),
myconcat([X,Y,Z],L2,Tail).

last(List,Last):-
myconcat(Front,[Last],List).

last([X],X).
last([H|T],X):-
last(T,X).

evenlength([]).
evenlength([A,B |T]):-
evenlength(T).

oddlength([A]).
oddlength([A,B |T]):-
oddlength(T).

reverse([],[]).
reverse([H|T],RevList):-
reverse(T,List),
myappend(H,List,RevList).

palindrome(List):-
reverse(List,RevList),
equalList(List,RevList).

equalList([],[]).
equalList([H|Tail1],[H|Tail2]):-
equalList(Tail1,Tail2).[/code]

Read full topic
